kpis.description: This KPI measures the percentage of revenue that remains as net income after all expenses have been deducted. It indicates how efficiently a company converts revenue into profit.
This KPI indicates the percentage of revenue that exceeds the cost of goods sold (COGS). It reflects the efficiency of production and pricing strategies.

kpis.kpi: net-income to avg shareholders equity percent
kpis.description: This KPI measures the return on equity (ROE), indicating how effectively a company uses shareholders' equity to generate net income.
This KPI assesses the proportion of operating revenue that is converted into net income, providing insight into operational efficiency.

kpis.kpi: net income growth rate to GDP growth rate difference
kpis.description: This KPI compares the growth rate of net income to the growth rate of GDP, indicating how well a company is performing relative to the overall economy.
kpis.formula: Net Income Growth Rate - GDP Growth Rate
